intro: Bellevalia dubia subsp. dubia, commonly known as the pale bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, pale blue or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is known for its delicate appearance. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its native range.
